attributes.action: Free public travel for NHS nurses
attributes.background: NHS nurses recieve an extremely small wage and the cost of almost daily public travel can be very expensive

attributes.action: Every private members bill allotted a debate is guaranteed to be put to a vote
attributes.background: The filibustering associated with the Turing Bill was an example of too much power concentrated in the hands of a few ministers. Any MP should be able to put bills before parliament, have them debated and voted upon. We need a proper constitution but this would be a step in the right direction.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties and punishments for bullies in school
attributes.background: Recently more and more children are being bullied and the incident is being posted on social media we need to show this is wrong and have stronger penalties and punishment for such behaviour to deter other people from doing it and show them this type of behaviour is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details: boy 11 died due to bullying 29.9.16

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Petition to finally shut down Dogs4Us and eradicate all puppy farming.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is still rife in the country and as a result thousands of animals are inhumanely treated and forced to breed. Millions of families receive animals who are in poor health and have numerous defects. Sadly many of these animals come from organisations like Dogs4Us. Lets stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs4Us has been exposed by numerous reputable news outlets yet the suffering still continuous. Together we can stop this abuse and shut down places like dogs4us as well as banning the act of puppy farming once and for all.

attributes.action: NHS to change the term Mental Health to Personal Health to get rid of the stigma
attributes.background: Many people take their own lives through depression and various psychological health issues. The term "Mental" creates a huge stigma and fear for many people who feel if they see someone from a mental health service then it will affect them later for work etc.
attributes.additional_details:
People believe that if you see a mental health specialist then your classed as a mental health patient and fear of being sectioned sets in. By changing this term we can hopefully have more lives saved by letting people feel more relaxed about their personal health issues and maybe they will find the strength to speak out.
From personal experience i was worried about driving into a mental health unit after suffering depression. i then asked for an alternative venue to have my meetings.

attributes.action: Candidates for positions of power must declare all associations to Organizations
attributes.background: When we have elections for Police Commissioners, MPs, Mayors etc, we should have the right to know what organizations the candidate are a member of so we can make a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: More and more positions of power within the Police, Army, Government & finance appear to being held by people who don't seem to represent the best interests of the people, this is one way of giving people more choice of who they want to represent them. We should be informed so that we can choose between people who put the interests of the people first or the interests of an Organization (secret or otherwise) causing a conflict of interest. Any person who fails to declare association with any society, Party or Organization (secret or Open)  should be removed from the position they hold

attributes.action: Stop aid to countries that have a nuclear/space program put monies saved in NHS
attributes.background: Billions are sent abroad to foreign countries that have nuclear or space programs or both. And our own NHS doesnt have enough funds to survive. Pakistan received over £300.000.0000 from the UK whilst spending millions on their space and nuclear ambitions. Let's readjust and help our NHS .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-34176846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-12607537
http://news.sky.com/story/ae-departments-fail-to-hit-waiting-times-for-16-months-nhs-figures-show-10725757

attributes.action: Open premises to homeless people when the temperature falls.
attributes.background: change the law, to require anyone who is responsible for a community centre or a sports hall to open their premises to homeless people when the temperature falls below a certain level.
attributes.additional_details: Just read a news story about a guy freezing to death on the coldest night of the year. It reached -9'c here. Its a simply request, which would help in cold weather, not a quick fix, but a start!

attributes.action: Focus primary school education on social skills and creativity rather than exams
attributes.background: The current curriculum focuses on tests and results. It is putting unacceptable pressure on young children. Many parents simply want schooling in primary years to focus on social skills, creativity and fun What value is there in creating highly educated but traumatised children?
attributes.additional_details: Mental health issues are soaring in children. Childline has reported a marked increase. Children face many pressures, some of which simply didn't exist for older generations. Piling additional pressures on children through rigorous testing achieves nothing but anxiety for both child and parent.

attributes.action: Make Philosophy a mandatory subject to be taught throughout a child's education.
attributes.background: Philosophy provides a lifetime of vital skills in reasoning and critical thought. Children will learn how to make logical arguments and spot fallacies, to question accepted truths, and to discuss the nature of reality and ethics. It will be beneficial to the individual and to society as a whole.
attributes.additional_details:
Teaching philosophy to primary school children can improve their English and maths skills, according to a pilot study highlighting the value of training pupils to have inquiring minds. (From http://www.independent.co.uk)

“If we leave questioning the models children have been taught until later in life, it could be too late," warns Professor Angie Hobbs. "That is why we need to start teaching philosophy in primary school.” (From http://www.telegraph.co.uk)

attributes.action: Reconsider changing bursaries to loans for Student Nurses and Midwives.
attributes.background: The government has recently voted to remove the NHS Bursary for Student Nurses and Midwives. Student Nurses and midwives work 37.5 per hours a week on placement, they should not have to pay for the privilege of becoming nurses, when they already work for that money!

attributes.action: Eliminate the state pension & benefits to pay for the costs of brexit
attributes.background: It is unfair for the costs of exiting the EU and any financial risk to our economy to be paid for by the young & employed.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of setting up & running the Department of Exiting the EU & any subsequent downturn in the economy should be paid for by eliminating the state pension, job seekers allowance, pension credit etc. Any future downturn in government tax receipts due to recession should be paid for by eliminating these programs before increasing VAT or pay roll taxes.

attributes.action: Allocate the child maintenance service with pre paid cards
attributes.background: This should be a made legal that the receiving parent receives a pre paid card that can only be spent on items for the children! Not alcohol, nights out, cigarettes ect.. I think it's time someone done something to help the paying parent for a change as they are the one out working and providing..
attributes.additional_details: I think that many paying parents would agree with what I am trying to get across.. children need the benefit of the money, not the receiving parent! A prepaid card would be best. One that can be used in certain shops for certain items. Food, soft drinks, shoes, school clothes, toys ect.. not for use for their own pleasure! Thank you

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents not to vaccinate a child
attributes.background:
Not vaccinating your children makes two things more likely
- Your child will get sick
- Your child will spread that illness to other unprotected children, some of whom may be too young to have received the necessary vaccination.
Therefore, not getting your child vaccinated is grossly negligent.
attributes.additional_details: Herd immunity is the primary reason for mass immunisation - in layman's terms, it means that the more people are immunised against a given disease, the less that disease will be able to spread, and more people (especially children too young to receive that specific vaccination) will be safe from it. We call on the government to criminalise non-vaccinating parents who refuse an initial order to vaccinate.

attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for anyone caught committing a Terror attack
attributes.background: In the light of recent terror attacks across the EU and the lenient prison sentences these individuals receive. We would like the law changed so that anyone committing or planning a terror attack, joining terror group and their accomplices receive a mandatory life sentence of no less than 25 years
attributes.additional_details: Recent terror attack in France saw a Priest beheaded by an individual recently released from Prison. He served a light sentence for trying to join an ISIS group in Syria. These people would of been safe if these individual had been jailed for life.

attributes.action: Lowering the state pension age for women born in the 50s back to 60 years old.
attributes.background: My mother was born on the 10th december 1953, if she was born 4 days earlier she would have retired 2 and half years ago. I'm sure a lot of the country is in the same situation. There wasn't enough time for people born in the 50s to save. This needs to change back to the state pension age of 60.

attributes.action: Stop children convicted of serious offences from attending mainstream schools
attributes.background: The current legislative framework MUST be reviewed to ensure those committing the most serious offences such as stabbing another child cannot return to mainstream school, putting the safety of children & teachers at risk
attributes.additional_details: There MUST be a minimum period of monitoring and psychological assessment within a specialist unit before offenders are reintegrated, irrespective of the number of previous exclusions a child has.  Disruptive behaviour currently carries the same punishment as stabbing.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for cinemas to provide access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.background:
1 in 6 people in the UK have some form of hearing loss or deafness, this accounts for 11 million people, with over 900,000 having a severe or profound deafness. 

Fewer than 1% of cinema screening are currently subtitled, we would like to see an increase in access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details:
On January 17th 2017, it becomes mandatory for all cinemas showing digital films within the United States of America to provide closed-caption personal subtitling devices at every showing. This means that open screen subtitling, which is infrequently programmed, isn't the only option for patrons with hearing loss. 

We believe that the UK should follow suit and provide proper access to those with hearing loss that wish to access the cinema.

attributes.action: For Corby to have their own hospital.
attributes.background: We have the urgent care centre in Corby, also known as 8-8. Who claim to have the resources of a hospital like KGH, but they do not. They lack observing sick patients. Mainly young children, to the point where they don't carry out the right tests to determine if that patient is really sick.
attributes.additional_details: The only evidence I have is my own son, who may I quote is only 1 in a few days. I recently took him to the urgent care centre on the 5/12/16, because his lack of breathing and chesty cough. I was sat there for four hours to only be told he's fine and his chest is clear. He had no observations done. The next day my son was rushed to hospital and I was told he was lacking oxygen really bad (65 out of 100 to be persist) he then had to have 5ml of steroids (oral) 8-8 failed my little boy.

attributes.action: Require all transport operators to offer child fares for anyone under 18
attributes.background: Change the law to require all transport operators to offer under 18's a child fair to help financially support 16!17 year olds of the UK. We are being classed as adults when it suits financially only.
attributes.additional_details: 16/17 year olds are paid a child wage so why should we pay an adult fare for a bus or a train? Until 18, we are not treated as an adult by the law. Until we are 18, parents and doctors can legally consent medical treatment which over rules our say. It seems to be all that is cared about is getting more money. As a 16 year old preparing for the cost of insuring a car and saving for university, it is essentially unaffordable, and this is the reality for most of us.

attributes.action: Make 12 November 2018 a Bank Holiday to commemorate 100 yrs since the Great War.
attributes.background: Over 1.1 million Service men and women lost their lives in the Great War. We invite you to create a dedication to each and every one of them and celebrate what they achieved. This day will be devoted to the remembrance of the fallen and to support charities across the UK dedicated to this cause.

attributes.action: Require the Department of Health to review outdated (1988) Child Growth Chart
attributes.background: Infants and Children's weight in the UK is measured on an outdated growth chart formulated in 1988 based on formula fed babies and children in 1988. This is wrongly leading to children and babies being "labelled" as obese from birth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for this petition as today my health visitor advised me that my child who was born just above the 75th centile for weight and above the 98th centile for height is "overweight".  (Despite being breastfed on demand for 16 months of his life, as per best advice to breastfeed for the first year.)
Despite this the Health Visitor tells me that at any contact with a health professional we are likely to be advised about regulating his weight.

attributes.action: Stop energy companies having the ablity to report to credit reference agencies.
attributes.background:
Companies like Npower have received over 2 million complaints from customers, with a wide range of problems and disputes.

Npower has already been fined 26 million pound.

Once you get into a dispute with the likes of npower they have the power to put bad credit marks within your credit file.
attributes.additional_details:
Npower have had huge problems with there IT systems and customer service levels, customers have been billed in error and many of there customers are subjected to harassment and receive default notices within there credit files through the mismanagement of how npower manager there customers accounts.

Complaints are received on a daily basics and npower are still not being held accountable.

My full story can been seen at http://www.npowercomplaints.uk

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis users to grow upto 5 plants without fear of prosecution
attributes.background: We are here to ask for the law to allow us users the ability to grow up to FIVE plants for personal use across the UK (Durham have already done this, as well as almost ALL of the USA with states by-passing the DEA to allow users access Washington State recently) from seed without taking cuttings!

attributes.action: abolish hate crime laws in the UK
attributes.background: A crime is a crime. the motivation for committing the offence should be inconsequential to the sentencing. Labelling an offence as racially, religiously or gender motivated only serves to create an 'us and them' mentality.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months police have been silencing anti  Islam and anti  refugee opinions by labelling them as hate crimes. recently Nottinghamshire police have taken the law into their own hands and have made misogyny a hate crime (but not misandry). This has turned certain groups into protected classes in society.

attributes.action: Raise awareness and increase funding for Mental Health.
attributes.background: Mental Health is a significant issue in the UK. Around 25% of all UK citizens experience mental illness, and almost a third of children in education will experience it. It is a silent issue that many feel embarrassed to discuss. Our aim is to raise support for those who experience mental illness.
attributes.additional_details: We (National Citizen Service) are currently aiming to work in association with a charity called 'Mind' who are currently supporting around 375,000 people, which is drastically less than the 25% that come forward regarding their mental illness.

attributes.action: The law protecting seagulls in the UK needs to be changed or suspended.
attributes.background: In recent years, the population of seagulls has increased to the point where they are more than just a nuisance. Adults and children have been attacked as these scavengers have become the rats by the sea. Food is not safe anywhere outdoors and this is affecting local businesses and residents.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to be changed or suspended so that people can protect themselves and their property, and the Government must also consider a humane cull of some sort.

attributes.action: Compulsory dyslexia tests in schools
attributes.background: At the moment there aren't compulsory tests for dyslexia in primary schools so thousands of children struggle through their school life without knowing that they have it. This needs to change so that they can receive support and advice to help them.

attributes.action: Elevate the Cotswolds area of outstanding natural beauty to national park status
attributes.background: The Cotswolds is already an area of outstanding natural beauty, but continues to be accosted by unsuitable development. By elevating it to become a national park, increased protections in planning law will defend its beauty for generations to come and provide a much needed Midlands national park.

attributes.action: Introduce tax on disposable coffee cups to reduce waste
attributes.background:
2,500,000,000 disposable coffee cups are thrown away in the UK each year. 

1 in 400 are recycled. The coffee industry and chains are NOT doing enough voluntarily to reduce waste. The tax for plastic bags worked-use fell massively. Let's consider the environment and do the same with coffee cups.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to start reducing our waste now before it is too late.

100,000 trees are used for the cups each year: 
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/oct/05/uks-billions-of-takeaway-cups-could-each-take-30-years-to-break-down

Ministers reject coffee cup tax despite massive wastage: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/oct/31/ministers-reject-calls-for-charge-on-disposable-coffee-cups

Plastic bag reductions: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-36917174

attributes.action: Remove status from charities paying staff more than 3 times the average wage.
attributes.background: Charities in the UK should have their charitable status removed if they pay any of their staff more than three times the average wage. Why should a pensioner on less than £150 a week give £5 to a charity that pays a CEO £200k? In 2016-2017 three times the average wage is £82,500. Many get more.
attributes.additional_details: By way of examples - Parkinson's UK has 10 staff earning between £60,000 and £130,000, The Royal British Legion has 26 staff earning between £60,000 and £160,000, Help for Heroes has 17 staff earning between £60,000 and £110,000 and Cancer Research UK has 219 staff earning between £60,000 and £250,000.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to cause injury to a ridden horse on a public road.
attributes.background: Due to an ever increasing number of serious accidents reported on UK roads involving horses, we feel that further care needs to be taken by other road users. The fact that there is no penalty for causing injury to horses by driving dangerously does not encourage drivers to use proper care.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory at all schools to have a time dedicated for napping.
attributes.background: A recent NASA study revealed that a 20 minute nap boosted cognition by almost 40%. Therefore in order for a students to fully focus throughout their school day the government should urge schools to set apart a time of day for sleep. Schools could provide dark rooms or pods for sleep only.

attributes.action: All businesses to have disabled access including a ramp and moving space inside.
attributes.background: A lot of small businesses don't have disabled access, preventing people (like my mother who was diagnosed with rheumatoid and osteoarthritis a few years back) entering shops. Some that do have a ramp to allow the disabled into the store don't have enough space to allow navigation around the store.
attributes.additional_details: Please help make it illegal for shops to not have disabled access (a ramp and enough space inside) as this prevents people, like my mother, entering shops whatsoever.

attributes.action: Exteremly poor service, revoke Govia Ltd's franchise of Great Northern Railways
attributes.background: GNR are continuously running a bad service. They have ongoing late running trains and often cancel services due to lack of staff and broken trains. They have not invested in new rolling stock and the trains are constantly dirty, seats are broken and trains break down.

attributes.action: Introduce Politics into the Key Stage 3 & 4 curriculum
attributes.background: We believe that politics should be an evenly taught subject with the objective to inform learners of what policies the current government have in place and the effect these can have on the country. Also to avoid being mislead by any inaccurate advertising by any campaign.
attributes.additional_details: "£350 million a week goes to the EU, let's put that into the NHS" - Misleading to those without an understanding of what the £350 million actually goes on.

attributes.action: Screen every mother leaving hospital after giving birth for Postnatal depression
attributes.background: I am a mother of two children. During my 2nd pregnancy I suffered with PND. I felt so alone, and scared, I wasn't screened even though I had said I wasn't well. I received help 14weeks after birth. Now I am better I support mums through their journeys with PND! More needs to be done for mums

attributes.action: Reduce the size of Motorcycle number plates
attributes.background: With HD cameras ANPR and better surveillance cameras the late 7 x 9 plate is not required and a more streamlined 6 x 4 plate would be adequate.  Motorcyclists can find the large plates cause drag and that also has a cost in respect of fuel usage. A smaller plate is more carbon efficient therefore.

attributes.action: Keep the army bound by the European Convention on Human Rights during conflict.
attributes.background: In her conference speech, Theresa May declared that the army would have an opt-out of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) during conflict. This means, in effect, that the army would have a free hand to violate basic human rights such as freedom from torture and the right to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details: The ECHR is an international treaty, drafted in 1950 and championed by British governments ever since. It sets out a series of fundamental rights that governments are bound to respect. This Convention was signed and ratified by the British government in the aftermath of the WWII to ensure that the human rights violations during this conflict would not happen again. For more information on the rights that the ECHR protects, visit: www.echr.coe.int/Documents/Convention_ENG.pdf

attributes.action: legislate to pay travel time from home as paid work to first job and last
attributes.background: Time spent travelling to and from first and last jobs by workers who do not have a fixed office should be regarded as work and should go on time sheet as paid work as workers are being stopped 10 hours per week
attributes.additional_details: the European Court of Justice judgement ruled those without a fixed or habitual office should consider the time they spend travelling between their homes and the premises of their first and last jobs as part of their hours for the day

attributes.action: Ban all schools from using mini buses.
attributes.background:
Schools drive pupils/students around in mini buses on basic car licences.
Ban all schools from doing this unless they employ a qualified PCV licence holder with up to date CPC card.
attributes.additional_details:
If schools had to use coach companies it would create jobs and boost business.
All drivers are qualified and CRB checked so children would be safe still.

attributes.action: Scrap car tax and put 1p on a litre of fuel.
attributes.background: Scrapping car tax (ved) and putting 1p on fuel will ensure everyone who drives pays the same, regardless of engine size, and no one can evade paying excise duty on fuel.

attributes.action: Mandatory vision and reaction check-up for all 75+ with a UK Driving license.
attributes.background: I have had personal experience of elderly drivers on wrong side of the road, being oblivious to cyclists, pulling out on roundabouts not noticing vehicles, stopping in main roads and causing serious collisions due to poor sight and reactions.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 over 75 year olds in the UK are suffering with vision loss; and from research I have found there are approximately 4 Million drivers over the age of 70 on UK roads.

The current system in place allows the individual to self-assess and to alert the DVLA if they are not fit to drive. In many cases if the individual needs the car for transport they will be reluctant to inform of any changes in health, vision etc. Completing a fast assessment will eliminate any possibility of this.

attributes.action: Stop Southeastern Railway from increasing their 2017 ticket fares
attributes.background:
Southeaster railway continues to increase annual season ticket fares each year but never improve upon the service they offer. It was voted one of the worst ways to commute to London in 2016. 
Train fares have been reported to increase twice as fast as salaries in the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
We all pay thousands of pounds a year to travel into London or elsewhere via Southeastern railway and each year it gets more expensive and the service gets worse and worse with signalling problems, delayed trains, cancelled trains etc. 
It needs to stop so that everyone pays a FAIR amount for the poor service we are getting. I'm sure most would agree that we would be happy to pay the amount we are paying if the trains ran on time and without delays and if we all got a seat on our long commutes.

attributes.action: Host a Referendum for an English National Anthem.
attributes.background: Our proposal of a public referendum would be an effective way of allowing the people of England to choose for themselves how they wish to express their identity in our family of nations. Just as Wales are permitted with Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau, and Scotland with Flower of Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: https://web.archive.org/web/20100615152120/http://www.weareengland.org/news.asp?itemid=327&itemTitle=England+announce+victory+anthem+for+Delhi+chosen+by+the+public%21&section=115&sectionTitle=News

attributes.action: Change rules for working Carers to hours worked, instead of £110 per week.
attributes.background: At the moment the rules for receiving Carer's Allowance states that you cannot earn more than £110 per week. If the government changed the rules to specify someone in receipt of CA can only work a certain number of hours instead it would be a lot more fair.
attributes.additional_details:
£110 divided by £7.20 (minimum wage) = 15 hours (approx)
£110 divided by £9.50 = 11.5 hours (approx)
Therefore someone on a lower wage is clearly disadvantaged, because they have to work longer hours to earn the weekly allowance.  This then means that the disabled person is disadvantaged by not having their carer present.

If the rules state you can work 15 hours it would be much fairer to all carers.

https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage-rates
https://www.gov.uk/carers-allowance/eligibility

attributes.action: To make food banks a legal obligation for all supermarkets in the UK.
attributes.background: Food banks play a big part in helping the homeless. Fortunately, some supermarkets have food banks, however there are still many large supermarkets who don't. We want to make a change, and make it policy that all supermarkets provide food banks to give back to the community.
attributes.additional_details: It costs nothing for supermarkets to provide this service, however it will make a huge difference to those in the community who need it.

attributes.action: Dads given 10 weeks parental leave with pay for more time with their new born
attributes.background: I believe dads should be around more with there new born child, some fathers work late nights and end up having to only see the new born child while they are sleeping. 2 weeks isn't anywhere near acceptable amount of time, also having dad home longer it will be great help for the mother and bonding.

attributes.action: Make accusing someone of been a racist without hard evidence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: In light of the recent EU referendum decision and increase in reports of hate crimes, a lot of innocent, decent and hardworking people like myself have been victims of accusations suggesting (with no proof or evidence to support their claims) that people who voted to leave the EU are somehow racist.
attributes.additional_details:
Branding someone as racist without any categorical evidence what so ever also seems to be a tactic that is becoming more of a problem in political and also everyday situations. 

Certain demographics of people are using this tactic to persecute other demographics of people in order to silence their personal views or beliefs to further their own personal or political agendas.

Been racist is a disgusting crime and been wrongly accused with no evidence can be permanently damaging to peoples lives.
